title: How many people will have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in the US as of 30 June 2021, according to the CDC?
preds: Just came across this, deadline is imminent so it's hard to be too wrong!
Per CDC reporting as of June 28 153.7M were vaccinated and 7-day moving average is around 502k and trending down, so it will come very close and there is a chance we reach above 155M by June 30.
cdc is reporting 153M, not going to go up significantly in 2 days

CDC: 153.77M people fully vaccinated, updates daily by 8 pm ET. The vaccination trends stop on Jun-27, so have 3 more days to the deadline and the difference is of 1.2M people. It is also about the type of vaccine, 1 dose or 2 doses to get fully vaccinated, and if the person had been inoculated or not with the 1st dose in case it is a 2 doses vaccine. Presuming each daily dose will add a fully vaccinated person, need ~410k per day to go above 155M fully vaccinated by the end of Jun-30. Pretty low chances to achieve the number with the actual declining trend in daily new doses administered, unless a pro vaccination campaign starts now and will have an instant effect. Have increased my forecast from 90% to 95% for "Between 145,000,000 and 155,000,000, inclusive".

NOTE: I'm still at 154.4-154.8M as the displayed total by July 4th, when all days are initially accounted for.
But I am now allowing an additional 1M+ as advised for back-reporting between then and the close of the question on 12th. 
Both @belikewater and @LunaSol have pointed out that numbers are revised upwards for a few days (separately to the most recent five days shown in dark blue) as final data trickles in, and this can add ~3-4 days to the total first shown.
Don't forget to add a bunch extra (I add 4 days) for back reporting, y'all.

152.9M as of 23 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 7 days left. Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 300K: bin 2.
2) Purely linear development at current level. Last 7 days: 16 June was 150.27, so 2.63 million more on 23 June. Would be enough for bin 3.

153M so far with three days left plus revisions. I'm expecting about 400k for each remaining day plus about 500k of upward data revisions. This is going to be close, but I'm still thinking if falls just below bin 3.
Vaccination was deployed rapidly but recently it has been slowing as there is still some people that are hesitante to vaccinate

152.08M as of 22 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 8 days left. Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 369K: bin 2.
2) Purely linear development at current level. Last 8 days: 14 June was 148.63, so 3.45 million more on 22 June. Would be enough for bin 3.

Having to back-track from 154.6M +-0.4, as I haven't allowed enough for back-reporting. Even 250K could tip this over.
I'm not sure I like these nail-biters any more.

Substantial lag in total case numbers is present; Sample of numbers recorded on the day (from personal record keeping): June 13: 143,921,222 
June 15: 145,768,367
June 17: 147,758,585
June 19: 149,125,164
June 21: 150,046,006 Numbers recorded from source (1), at of time of posting
June 13: 148,072,711 (+4.15M)
June 15: 149,248,926 (+3.48M)
June 17: 150,370,330 (+2.61M)
June 19: 151,253,384 (+2.13M)
June 21: 151,668,497 (+1.62M) Given the US is past 153M fully vaccinated persons as of today, I will expect number for June 30th to tick past 155M around the end of the first week of July.  1. https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccination-trends

0.846M added in the past day. Current total 153.03M. 1.97M to go. 7 days left in forecast. Would need to stay <0.28M average. Not going to happen. I'm going to have a terrible Brier score on this. I am surprised that the rate at which people were getting 2nd doses has increased.
Interesting change. 153 million as of 25 June. Some backreporting with 5 days to go after that, and this looks quite good. Very close, but "no risk, no fun".

The data won't be accessed until July 12, so lots of time for upward revisions.  It's difficult to determine the trend rate, given the lag in the data and the (apparently) decreasing vaccinations.  I'll stay close to the crowd.

Since I am fully vaccinated since a couple of hours, I guess I should finally join the forecast crowd here ;-)
It’s a tough one - perhaps it will be, like last time with the “1+ dose” question, a nail-biter way into the next month….

151.6m plus 1m backlog = 152.6m
5 days to go
155m threshold = 2.4m = 0.48m per day.   Borderline at current rate, but last couple of full reported days are quite low compared to the previous weeks so think it is getting harder to get to 155m

Today should have been a high day of the week, but instead, today's results made it clear that 2nd doses are falling off.
151.62M today. 0.36M added in the past day. 19 days left in the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting). 3.38M to go to reach 155M; must stay < 0.376M/day to stay <155M.
The forecast will be close, and it needs to be watched closely, but I think it's leaning more towards <155M.

I agree with everyone that it's going to be close. My rationale is that the step drop off in dose 1 last month with create a lagged drop off in dose 2. Therefore, my assumption is that the trend will be downward through next week, ended up right around 154M.

150.5; 484K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 19 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 11 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 418K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +5.32 milion (lower end of third bin).
138.9 million vaccinated by 2021_06_13, with the latest daily average of 492'000 people vaccinated there is a high probability that the 2nd option will be the real one

151.3m plus 1m backlog = 152.3m
6 days to go
155m threshold = 2.7m = 0.45m per day.  (Or for 5 days 0.52m) Current rate 0.486m per day. Still border line depends on trend.  Going for not getting there.
Based on current number (~156M), the rate of increase for the last two months, and the fact that the monthly increments are getting smaller

151.25M. 0.46M added in the past day. 10 days left in the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting). 3.75M to go to reach 155M; must stay < 0.375M/day to stay <155M. This is traditionally a higher reporting day. This forecast is going to be very close.

332M people less 151M vaccinated as of 6/24 leaves 182M unvaccinated with six days to go at a 7 day average rate of 228k indicates approximately 152M will be vaccinated, but small chance aggressive government and private sector incentives will lift that over 155M ahead of Biden Admin's much touted (and ridiculous) goal of 70% by July 4.

150.4; 484K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 19 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 11 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 418K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +5.32 milion (lower end of third bin).

Gradually looking slightly more likely under 155k.
I think this will be the outcome, but my range of possibility is still straddling the break point
I’m now at 154.6M +-0.5

150.1; 521K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 18 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 12 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 409K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +6.25 milion (third bin). My base scenario.

150.79M total today. 4.21M to go. 11 days left in forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting). Must stay under 0.38M/day for the remainder of the forecast to stay under 155M. 0.37M added in the past day. Wednesdays are traditionally somewhat low reporting days, but vaccinations are falling. Tentatively favoring bin 2.

Rethink: is there a way for the average daily number from 17 to 30 June to fall below 423K?
Looking back at the number of first doses, which need to be given at least 3 weeks (Pfizer) or 4 weeks (Moderna) before the second one. "Worst case": it was all Pfizer, that has been given. Looking back, the average number of first doses given 3 weeks before this question ends was around 400K a day. And it was always higher before (so some second shots Moderna and AZ can be added). Even if we need to subtract those, who decide to only get one shot and "some J&J back then and none in the future" there should still be about 400K a day by the end of June getting "full vaccination".
Looks quite good to end up in bin 3. https://www.cdc.gov/mmwr/volumes/70/wr/mm7011e2.htm
155M - 150.424678M (as of June 22) = 4.575M / 8 days = 571,915 average vaccinations per day over the next 8 days.  This seems unlikely given past few days with fully vaccinated trending down.

I’m still forecasting 154.8M +-0.5
Could go either way

a) 149.5; 555K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 17 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 13 days left).
b) 150.0; 517K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 18 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 12 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below a) 423K: bin 2 b) 417K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: a) +7.2 milion (bin 3). b) +6.2 (bin 3). My base scenario.

According to https://www.statista.com/statistics/1198516/covid-19-vaccinations-administered-us-by-company/, only 12M J&J shots had been administered as of June 20.  There are news reports of J&J doses nearing expiration.  See https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/many-johnson-johnson-covid-vaccine-doses-may-be-close-expiring-n1270038. The J&J numbers are important for this question, since it only requires one shot to be fully vaccinated.  The J&J shot is easier to store, so it makes sense to use it in rural areas.  But those are the places with the most vaccine hesitant people.  Based on the numbers of people receiving their first vaccine dose 3-4 weeks ago there aren't that many people lined up for second shots over the next 8 days.  See https://covid.cdc.gov/covid-data-tracker/#vaccination-trends.  A back of the envelop calculation indicates that 460k/day 2nd shots, plus a 900k bump due to data lag, are required to exceed 155M on June 30.  I could be in the weeds, but I'll bet against the crowd this time, with an overweight on bin 2.

4.95M to go. 12 days left in forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting). Must stay under 0.41M/day to stay under 155M. 0.38M added in the past day. Tuesdays are traditionally low reporting days, but I think vaccinations are falling.

148.9; 581K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 16 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 14 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 440K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +8.13 milion (middle of third bin). My base scenario.

148.9; 581K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 16 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 14 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 436K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +8.13 milion (almost middle of third bin). My base scenario. Affirming.

Impressed with anyone at 100% on this question
I'm at 154.8 +- 0.5M

After a closer look, I'm going back to thinking bin 2 is more likely. Over the past 2 days, 0.4M/day were added. Need to stay under an average of 0.38M/day to stay in bin 2. Vaccine administration is starting to fall again, so I think we'll probably end up in bin 2.

5.33M remaining to go for the remaining 14 days of the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting). 5.33M/14 = 0.38M/day average. 0.64M/day added over the past 3 days. This number is starting to fall, but will it fall to <0.38M/day? I don't know.

148.3; 610K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 15 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 15 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 447K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +9.15 milion (almost middle of third bin). My base scenario. Affirming.

I still think it's going be to be very close to 155M.
I'm still forecasting 154-156 - too close for me to call

147.6M; 631K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; (as of 14 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 16 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 463K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +10.01 milion (almost middle of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots

Total currently 149.13M. 0.86M/day added in the past week. As of yesterday, it was 0.91M/day. 15 days left in the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting).
149.13M + .86M * 15 = 162.03M.
To stay under 155M, need to add an average of <=0.39M/day. We could get there.

Total currently 148.46M. 0.91M/day added in the past week. 16 days left in the forecast (inc. 4 for back reporting).
148.46M + 0.91M*16 = 163.00M.
To stay under 155M, would need to add an average of <=0.41M/day. Given that we're currently at 0.91M/day for the past week, this is looking less likely to me, at least.
This month's vaccine administrations are breaking patterns we've seen in previous months. If we do go over 155M, it will represent a substantial decrease in the time to 2nd dose administration; that time period had been increasing.

147M; 646K 7-day rolling average; (as of 13 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 17 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 470K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +10.98 milion (almost middle of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots Note to self: there seem to be some updates within each day. It´s going to be more than expected in the end. As always with CDC. A little more than expected in the end.
Affirming.

Still looks very close to the break to me
153.5-156.5
As of yesterday, 147 million. Two days ago, 146 million. Three days ago, 145 million. I don't understand why there won't be 8 million more in 13 days.

146.6M; 650K 7-day rolling average;175M with at least one dose (as of 12 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 18 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 467K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +11.70 milion (almost middle of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (28M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.

147.7m plus 1m backlog = 148.7m
12 days to go
155m threshold = 0.525m per day.   Current rate = 0.6m recovered nicely as didn’t expect.  So quite likely to get past now, but rates are dipping again.

145.5M; 622K 7-day rolling average, decreasing; 312M total doses; 175M with at least one dose (as of 11 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 19 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 500K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +11.82 milion (lower end of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (almost 30M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible. Additional thoughts: in the time frame from 3 to 6 weeks ago (the recommended time frame between shots for BioNTech/Pfizer and Moderna) the lowest number 7-day rolling average of daily first shots has been 573K. Even with some people not going for their second shot and some who wait longer (AstraZeneca) that would be enough to stay above 500K second doses. BUT: in the last three weeks the number of first shots went down sharply. Numbers for second shots will follow, so this might be very close in the end. Affirming 50:50 for now.

146.46M as of today. 0.78M/day added in the past week. 18 days remaining in forecast (including **4** days for back reporting).
To get to 155M: 8.54M / 18 days = 0.47M/day
The regular daily pattern of dose reporting and administration has been disrupted.
We should be past the 2nd week of vaccinating the bump in adolescents. I would expect numbers to be falling now, but they're not yet.
Unless I'm reading something wrong, all that's required is 615,000 a day on average to become fully vaccinated to hit 155 million.
Expect the vaccine count not to decrease that drastically given surge in cases and perhaps demand.

144.7M; 641K 7-day rolling average, decreasing?; 310M total doses; 174M with at least one dose (as of 10 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 20 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers to an average below 515K: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +12.87 milion (lower end of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (almost 30M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.

To me, it looks to be heading closer and closer to 155M ...
Forecast range 153-157

143.9M; 653K 7-day rolling average, trend up in the last week; 309M total doses; 174M with at least one dose (as of 9 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 21 days left). Realistic scenarios:
1) Decrease in daily numbers: bin 2
2) Purely linear development at current level: +13.7 milion (lower end of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (30M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.

Currently 144.92M. 0.74M/day added in the past week. 10.08M more to go to get to 155M. 20 days left in forecast (now including *4* days for back reporting; got burned for going with 3 last month). 10.08M / 20 days = 0.50M/day to reach 155M. When I look at doses given this week and last, I see a lot of 2nd doses for adolescents, 3 weeks after the bumps in doses given 3 and 4 weeks ago. In other words, it would seem very likely to me that in a few days, doses given will start falling off again, perhaps by about 1/3. So, suppose 0.74M/day added for 5 more days (inc. back reporting) => total 148.61M. Then 6.39M to go to 155M, in 15 days => 0.43Mday. Can 0.43M/day be sustained for 2 weeks? 2/3 * 0.74M = 0.50M. It looks possible.... bumping up the probability for the third bin.

Still on track with original forecast 150-156M. However I think the likelihood is now in the upper range of 153-156, which straddles the break point.
This may become quite difficult to call as we near the deadline.

142.8M; 647K 7-day rolling average, trend up in the last week; 308M total doses; 173M with at least one dose (as of 8 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 22 days left). Scenarios:
1) Purely linear development at current level: +14.2 milion (lower end of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (30M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.
4) Big increase, up to an average of 1M per day required for bin 4 (let´s not discuss the other ones, they´re too far away)? Very unlikely. Conclusion: the number of not yet given second shots is easily enough to get us into bin 3, and the daily numbers are increasing. On the other hand the general trend in new vaccinations does not look good. Daily update required.

142M; 639K 7-day rolling average, trend up in the last week; 306M total doses; 173M with at least one dose (as of 7 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 23 days left). Scenarios:
1) Purely linear development at current level: +14.7 milion (lower end of third bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (staying in bin 3),
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible.
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (30M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.
4) Big increase, up to an average of 1M per day required for bin 4 (let´s not discuss the other ones, they´re too far away)? Very unlikely. Conclusion: the number of not yet given second shots is easily enough to get us into bin 3, and the daily numbers are increasing. On the other hand the general trend in new vaccinations does not look good. Daily update required.
It’s now 143 million. It’s been averaging about a million a day for the past few days. There are 17 days left this month. The crowd’s .83 chance of it remaining below 155 million seem a bit high.

141M; 556K 7-day rolling average, trend up in the last week; 305M total doses; 172M with at least one dose (as of 6 June, calculating from there because of reporting lag, so 24 days left). Scenarios:
1) To stay in bin 1 we need a daily average below 375K. Looks quite absurd to me. Numbers would need to fall to about zero in the next weeks to get there.
2) Purely linear development at current level: +13.3 milion (upper end of second bin). My base scenario.
3) Slight increase (leading us into bin 3), 
a) possibly driven by more J&J doses counting as full vaccination leading us into bin 3? Unlikely, as there seem to be delivery problems, but possible. 
b) driven by more people getting their second shots (31M of those not having it still out there)? Quite possible.
4) Big increase, up to an average of 1M per day required for bin 4 (let´s not discuss the other ones, they´re too far away)? Very, very unlikely. Conclusion: the number of not yet given second shots is easily enough to get us into bin 3. On the other hand the general trend in new vaccinations does not look good. Daily update required.

142.1m plus 1m backlog = 143.1m
18 days to go.
Daily average @550k and unlikely to increase.
Thresholds
145m = 1.9m = 105k per day
155m = 11.9m = 661k per day
Still on track with original forecast 150-156M
155 million 1st dose milestone was reached on May 8th. Plenty of time to hit that in 2nd doses by June 30th

I think the figure will trend upwards slightly as a result of the younger age groups 2nd doses and increase in cases prompting people to complete the course. 
Forecast 150-156M

139.75M today. 138.97M yesterday. 0.78M added in the past day. >145M looking more likely. >155M also possible.
Update 6/9 morning: 0.65M/day added in the past week, total at 140.44M, 25 days remaining in forecast (inc. 3 for back reporting). If 0.65M/day were added for the remainder of the forecast, then total would be 156.69M. But the rate at which people are added to this category has been declining and will likely continue to decline overall. 14.56M more to go to reach 155M; would need to add an average of 0.58M/day to reach 155M. Next week might add an average of ~0.6M/day, as adolescents get their second doses. But then it will likely decline after that. I'm not optimistic that we'll reach 155M in the forecast period.

Rethinking this. Total at 138.11M, with 0.67M added in the past day. The next few days may remain close to last week's level, or higher, as teenagers get their second doses. Will probably continue falling after that. So, perhaps in the ballpark of 7M will be added over the next 2 weeks or so. Then less afterwards.

137.5m plus 1.5m backlog = 139m
25 days to go.
Daily average @600k and unlikely to increase.  More likely to keep tailing off as reach saturation
Thresholds
145m = 6m = 240k per day
155m = 16m = 640k per day
If rates are currently 600k then will be hard getting beyond 155m.

Must be quite a few people out there who didn't get their second dose last month. I'm guessing 20 to 25 million below the current first dose numbers, but it's also possible late second doses trickle in over time. So targeting around 150 million with a small extended tail to the right.

[Right after I posted my forecast comments here, I realized I was combining 2 forecast comments, and I went to fix this one. But my power went out. After it came back on, I tried to fix it, and thought I had. But I just realized nonsense was still posted! Anyway, finally deleted now.]

I don't know what the floor will be. Knowing this would make it easier. However, President Biden himself has acknowledged that the demand has dropped (see article). https://apnews.com/article/biden-announces-international-covid-vaccine-sharing-plan-cc4630f1d45b379c573c55a2042026e0

4.79M added in the past week, or 0.68M/day, although this was an unusual week with the holiday. 0.77M/day added over the past 2 weeks. 136.16M total as of today. As of April 23, 137M had received at least one vaccine dose (some of which were, of course, J&J); the numbers are slowing down, and it now takes more than 1 month for the fully vaccinated number to catch up to the number of people who have received at least one dose. As of today, 168.7M people have had at least one dose. I think that provides an upper ceiling for this question. If 0.7M people are added per day and falling, then with 31 forecast days left (inc. 3 for back reporting), then I'd expect no more than 21.7M to be added to today's total, or 152.9M. (In the past 31 days, 31.4M were added.) But numbers are falling off quickly, so the total could end up in the first bin. I also don't completely rule out the third bin.

Goal of 160mn by July 4th will be hard to meet, but I do expect the rate to recover in the declared "National month of action" and a final number of 156mn persons fully vaccinated.
https://edition.cnn.com/2021/06/02/politics/anheuser-busch-white-house-vaccinations-beer/index.html

It seems to be plateauing around 143MM but *might* eclipse the 145MM mark by the 30th. I can't imagine a true rush towards the end of the month. There will likely be a rush in August though in preparation for those entering college.
